metadata.title: CVE-2022-47520 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.0.11. Missing offsetvalidation in drivers/net/wireless/microchip/wilc1000/hif.c in the WILC1000wireless driver can trigger an out-of-bounds read when parsing a RobustSecurity Network (RSN) information element from a Netlink packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47520` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-67-generic-64k - 5.15.0-67.74
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1029-kvm - 5.15.0-1029.34
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1031-aws - 5.15.0-1031.35
No subscription required

No subscription required
